reviews.review_msg: Seems to enjoy teaching and knows and presents the material well. Makes you want to go into Physics.

Excellent Prof. Great communications skills complimented by an ethusiasm for all things Physics. Patient and approachable. Does an excellent job of explaining the most complex concepts and theories. Brilliant and easy on the eyes! To all the nay sayers....grow up...it's university....spoon feeding knowledge and information is long over.
Easy A, if you did well in physics 12.

at first I thought he was an okay prof..but after a while I'm just totally lost. His exams doesn't really relate to what he teach, like his examples. His notes are kind of hard to understand when you go back to review them.. but overall, he's not a bad guy just need stronger communication skills. Reading the text may confuse you more, but oh well..
Get ready to completely study on your own unless you are a genius who can absorb tons of new information during the lecture and also later be able to understand his notes by going over them again.

The major issue with this prof is that he does not communicate with his students. He makes constant errors on his notes. Perhaps he is not interested in what he is teaching. He is flexible, though. He is tolerant about assignment redos. He also seems to show interest when students approach him first. So, if in this course, talk to him alot.

This teacher has a strong grasp of physics, but it by no means translates to a good teacher. I can relate to all the previous negative comments: lack of clarity, disinterest in the course, failure to respond to requests for help; they're all too true. If you get this teacher, be prepared to seek help elsewhere.

Worst possible teacher that I have ever had. He is a good guy. He laughs at his own jokes. Kinda naive type. The problem is that he lacks enthusiasm and helpfulness. Things are not posted up on time. He does not consider if students understand concepts or not. He just speaks and writes down what he speaks.
He is quite condescending and doesn't appear to want to teach a lower level class. When you ask for clarification, he treats you like a moron. Avoid if possible.

the good thing is he records lect and posts up notes, so no need to go to class. the bad thing is it takes him a while to post notes and sometimes they're in the wrong order. pay attention to the practice mc q's in class, he used them on the exams. problems in class were similar to the exam q's. marking is fair. does not respond to emails

agree with previous posters...he might be a nice guy but his teaching ability is slightly lacking. tends to mumble even with the mic turned up, he doesnt explain his notes but rather just reads out the words he writes. on the other hand, his exams are a lot easier than what he goes through in class so make sure you read the book and ull be fine.

If you like repeating classes then take this class with him. He is guaranteed to bring your GPA down. Just because they have a degree does NOT mean they have the ability to teach! This guy definitely SHOULD NOT be teaching!!!

This is by far the worst instructor I have encountered. He does not teach he mumbles, he doesn't post anything on time, weeks will go by without having assignment marks. He will not respond to emails. He is clearly very uninterested in teaching this class. Aviod him at all costs. The TA's teaching abilities were far superior to his.

this guys doesn't even give out practice exams for midterms or the final! like wtf? His teaching is ok, but he mumbles a lot to himself. He's a nice guy though. Helpful is you approach him. Good demo's in class. I'd give the class a 3/5 stars. I'd give his teaching a 3.5/5 stars. I found the TA's to be more helpful than him.
